channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0

  • Description: The wet package was found this morning and placed in a plastic lined hazmat tote and brought to QA for inspection. Upon inspection the package was found to be a LQ damaged hazmat. All proper hazmat procedures were followed.

item.title: Report X-2024080622
item.description:
Report X-2024080622

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-01
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DUE TO VISIBLE FROST FORMING ON THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY TWO POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS SURROUNDING A STYROFOAM COOLER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE OUTER BOX HAS AN OLD FEDEX GROUND TRACKING LABEL STILL APPLIED.

item.title: Report X-2024080036
item.description:
Report X-2024080036

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-31
  • City: SAGINAW
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was found wet on the outside of the box. Proper PPE was used to inspect the package. Upon inspection it was discovered that one of the bottles had a loose cap which led to the leak. The package was then placed in a hazmat bin. There was no inner packaging inside the box which likely helped contribute to the spill.

item.title: Report E-2024070529
item.description:
Report E-2024070529

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-09
  • City: Lansing
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 07/09/2024, at 1300 hrs., CSX Hazardous Materials Manager Scott Karcher discovered in the CSX Ensel Yard, the GATX29637, a loaded tank car of Acetone, releasing product vapor from the vacuum relief valve (VRV). The car was isolated and the shipper, Altivia Chemical, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-07-09-00182). EnviroServe, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and determined the VRV was faulty. Contractor personnel removed the defective vacuum relief valve and applied a securement plug to stop the vapor release. The issue was identified, and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper's representative (Jeremy Walker, 740-533-5232, jwalker@altivia.com).
